content: of yarn over method so insert the hook yarn under pull up a loop pull through two loops this is how i crochet the single_crochet stitches in the tutorials here special techniques front post double_crochet find a quick video here yo and insert your hook behind the single_crochet three row below yo 3 loops on the hook pull through two loops pull through two loops again 1 loop on the hook colour change here the colour of yarn is changed every two row at the end of the row to change colour from colour a to colour b or the other way around for the last single_crochet of the row insert the hook as usual but yarn over with the new colour tc in the new colour and follow the next row as from instruction gauge full tutorial & video tutorial for the gauge swatch 4 5 mm hook 10 cm x 10 cm = 15 sts x 4 set of squares that is 16 row in pattern in colour a note blue in pics 2 chain 15 row 1 single_crochet in the second chain from hook single_crochet in each chain tc 14 in colour b note sage green in pics row 2 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 14 row 3 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 14 in colour a row 4 *single_crochet in the first two sts fpdc in the next st - placed three row below* repeat until you have 2 sts left place a single_crochet in each tc 14 note the fpdc is placed in the only single_crochet sts row in colour a row 5 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 14 with row 5 the first set of squares repeat for another 3 sets of squares 4 sets of squares in total pattern 4 5 mm in colour a chain 45 made-to-measure tip this chain is as long as the book width x 2 + a few cm so that it s not too snuggly if your book is bigger than the standard paper-cover novel or you are using a different yarn+hook combo wrap the chain around the book to be sure it s long enough you want to have a number of chains that is a multiple of 3 you can see here how the fabric wraps the book before sewing the edges this is the wrong side of the fabric 3 row 1 single_crochet in the second chain from hook single_crochet in each chain tc 44 in colour b row 2 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 44 row 3 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 44 in colour a row 4 *single_crochet in the first two sts fpdc in the next st - placed three row below* repeat until you have 2 sts left place a single_crochet in each tc 44 row 5 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 44 repeat row 2 to row 5 for a total
